gw.api.graph

Class Graph<T extends Object>

  • gw.api.graph.Graph<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadableGraph<T>

    public class Graph<T extends Object>
implements ReadableGraph<T>
    A mathematical graph-theory graph object G(V,E) which contains a set V of vertices and a set E of edges. Each edge e=(v1,v2) in E connects vertex v1 to vertex v2. Here the graph vertex is referred to as a Node.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gw.api.graph.ReadableGraph

        Edges, Nodes

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addEdge(Object source, Object target, Object weight)
      Adds an Edge using the given source and target, and having the given weight.
      boolean addEdge(Object source, Object target)
      Adds an edge to the graph using the given source and target nodes.
      boolean addEdge(Edge<Object> edge)
      Adds an edge to the graph. Source and target nodes will be added to the node set if not present.
      boolean addNode(Object node)
      Adds a node to the graph.
      GraphView<Object> asView()
      Returns a read-only view of the graph.
      boolean hasPath(Path<Object> path)
      Returns true if the graph contains the given path.
      void merge(Graph<Object> otherGraph)
      Merges the other graph into this one, i.e. adds all the nodes and edges from the other graph.
      boolean removeEdge(Edge<Object> edge)
      Removes the given edge from the graph.
      boolean removeNode(Object node)
      Removes a node from the graph. This operation will also remove any edges where the given node is the target or source.
      Graph<Object> shallowCopy()
      Creates a (shallow) copy of the graph.

      • Methods inherited from class gw.api.graph.ReadableGraph

        getIncomingEdges, getOutgoingEdges

      • addEdge

        boolean addEdge(Object source,
              Object target,
              Object weight)
        Adds an Edge using the given source and target, and having the given weight.
        Parameters:
        source - The source node
        target - The target node
        weight - The edge weight
        Returns:
        True if edge wasn't already in the graph

              Object target)
        Adds an edge to the graph using the given source and target nodes.
        Parameters:
        source - The source node
        target - The target node
        Returns:
        True if edge wasn't already in the graph

      • addEdge

        boolean addEdge(Edge<Object> edge)
        Adds an edge to the graph. Source and target nodes will be added to the node set if not present.
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to add
        Returns:
        True if edge added

      • addNode

        boolean addNode(Object node)
        Adds a node to the graph.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add
        Returns:
        True if graph did not already contain the node

        Returns a read-only view of the graph.
        Returns:
        The read-only view

        Returns:

        Merges the other graph into this one, i.e. adds all the nodes and edges from the other graph.

      • removeEdge

        boolean removeEdge(Edge<Object> edge)
        Removes the given edge from the graph.
        Parameters:
        edge - The edge to remove
        Returns:
        True is edge was removed (i.e., present in graph)

      • removeNode

        boolean removeNode(Object node)
        Removes a node from the graph. This operation will also remove any edges where the given node is the target or source.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to remove
        Returns:
        True if node was removed (i.e. it was in the graph)

        Creates a (shallow) copy of the graph.
        Returns:
        The shallow graph copy
